alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 20 at 2:52AM PST until January 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet, along with dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected within a couple of hours of the high tide Sunday morning. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 PM PST Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 2 AM to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely around the time of high tide, mainly in vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides near 6.0 feet are expected at around 600 AM PST Sunday.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
